abstract: The book introduces expert systems for problem solving in urban planning and describes the way in which heuristic knowledge and rules of thumb of expert planners can be represented through computer programs. The individual chapters present practical applications for solving urban planning problems. There are five groups of papers, each with an editorial introduction: introduction to expert systems; applications to land use and transportation planning; expert systems in site selection; expert systems in environmental planning, conflict mediation and legal disputes; future research directions. Papers in each section are grouped by complexity of implementation. The 15 papers are abstracted separately. -after Editors
